Join CVS Health, a Fortune 7 company.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor is responsible for the quality and cohesion of solution architecture components within PBM and RxClaim applications, and their conformance to approved CVS Health IT standards and procedures. The Lead will ensure consistent alignment of technical solutions with the business goals and objectives of the supported unit.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will serve as a senior application developer lead providing industry leading technical direction and guidance to the RxClaim application development teams to ensure appropriate and cost effective application of CVS Health approved technologies.<BR><BR>As part of the Rx Claim Adjudication team, you will be expected to be proficient in all critical functions of the application development and will champion SDLC methodologies with a deep understanding of best practices to ensure that quality standards are met. We believe for success, you should have flexibility, possess a positive outlook, discernment, and inspire change within a fast growing environment.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will be responsible for, but not limited to:<BR>\u2022 Lead development estimation activities and present to senior leaders<BR>\u2022 Make certain appropriate and effective data integration across multiple applications<BR>\u2022 Provide solutions and design complex functionality within the RxClaim application<BR>\u2022 Positively mentor and lead assigned team projects and mentor junior resources as needed<BR>\u2022 Review technical solutions and document projects, for example: Analysis & Designs Program specifications and Code Reviews<BR>\u2022 Help define standards, methodologies, and guidelines to ensure compliance while aligning solutions to the RxClaim application architecture<br\/><br\/><b>Required Qualifications<\/b><br\/>\u2022 5+ years of experience and a demonstrated deep understanding of AS400 application development including the following:<BR>\u2022 3+ years of experience leading concurrent technical projects on IBM iSeries<BR>\u2022 3+ years of application development experience in RPG, RPGLE, and CL.<BR>1+ Year of Synon experience.<br\/><br\/><b>Preferred Qualifications<\/b><br\/>\u2022 Application development experience in Synon2\/E and COOL 2\/E<BR>\u2022 3+ years of IBMi SQL experience<BR>\u2022 Experience with RxClaim or other PBM Adjudication system is preferred<BR>\u2022 Experience in COBOL<BR>\u2022 Demonstrated successful completion of several medium to large scope projects<BR>\u2022 Proficiency working on all phases of SDLC and with problem determination and resolution through research and fact finding<br\/><br\/><b>Education<\/b><br\/>Bachelor\u2019s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent required. Will accept a verifiable H.S. diploma \/ GED with one year of relevant work experience for every year college not attained in addition to required years of experience.<br\/><br\/><b>Business Overview<\/b><br\/>At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health.  We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  <p> <BR>We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex\/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. The Lead will ensure consistent alignment of technical solutions with the business goals and objectives of the supported unit.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will serve as a senior application developer lead providing industry leading technical direction and guidance to the RxClaim application development teams to ensure appropriate and cost effective application of CVS Health approved technologies.<BR><BR>As part of the Rx Claim Adjudication team, you will be expected to be proficient in all critical functions of the application development and will champion SDLC methodologies with a deep understanding of best practices to ensure that quality standards are met. We believe for success, you should have flexibility, possess a positive outlook, discernment, and inspire change within a fast growing environment.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will be responsible for, but not limited to:<BR>\u2022 Lead development estimation activities and present to senior leaders<BR>\u2022 Make certain appropriate and effective data integration across multiple applications<BR>\u2022 Provide solutions and design complex functionality within the RxClaim application<BR>\u2022 Positively mentor and lead assigned team projects and mentor junior resources as needed<BR>\u2022 Review technical solutions and document projects, for example: Analysis & Designs Program specifications and Code Reviews<BR>\u2022 Help define standards, methodologies, and guidelines to ensure compliance while aligning solutions to the RxClaim application architecture<br/><br/><b>Required Qualifications</b><br/>\u2022 5+ years of experience and a demonstrated deep understanding of AS400 application development including the following:<BR>\u2022 3+ years of experience leading concurrent technical projects on IBM iSeries<BR>\u2022 3+ years of application development experience in RPG, RPGLE, and CL.<BR>1+ Year of Synon experience.<br/><br/><b>Preferred Qualifications</b><br/>\u2022 Application development experience in Synon2/E and COOL 2/E<BR>\u2022 3+ years of IBMi SQL experience<BR>\u2022 Experience with RxClaim or other PBM Adjudication system is preferred<BR>\u2022 Experience in COBOL<BR>\u2022 Demonstrated successful completion of several medium to large scope projects<BR>\u2022 Proficiency working on all phases of SDLC and with problem determination and resolution through research and fact finding<br/><br/><b>Education</b><br/>Bachelor\u2019s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent required. Will accept a verifiable H.S. diploma / GED with one year of relevant work experience for every year college not attained in addition to required years of experience.<br/><br/><b>Business Overview</b><br/>At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health.             "maxValue": 1000000.0,
            "unitText": "YEAR"
        }
    }
}                 
</script>

<h1 style="margin-top:0;">Advisor, AS/400 Application Development (Remote)</h1>
<p><strong>Job ID:</strong> 1557486BR<br />
<strong>Category:</strong>Information Systems<br />
<strong>Address:</strong> 1703 Plano Rd<br />
<strong>Location:</strong> Richardson, TX</p>
<p><a href="https://www.applytracking.com/tp/rj6-thnfN-I-K" class="fusion-button button-default fusion-button-default-size apply-btn">Apply</a></p>
<p>
<!-- AddThis Advanced Settings above via filter on the_content --><!-- AddThis Advanced Settings below via filter on the_content --><!-- AddThis Advanced Settings generic via filter on the_content --><!-- AddThis Share Buttons above via filter on the_content --><!-- AddThis Share Buttons below via filter on the_content --><div class="at-below-post-page addthis_tool" data-url="https://jobs.cvshealth.com/job/13253808/advisor-as-400-application-development-remote-/"></div><!-- AddThis Share Buttons generic via filter on the_content -->
</div><div class="fusion-text fusion-text-3" style="transform:translate3d(0,0,0);"><div class="at-above-post-page addthis_tool" data-url="https://jobs.cvshealth.com/job/13253808/advisor-as-400-application-development-remote-/"></div><p><b>Job Description</b><br />Utilize your technical skills to make an impact on the health of the people we serve. Join CVS Health, a Fortune 7 company.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor is responsible for the quality and cohesion of solution architecture components within PBM and RxClaim applications, and their conformance to approved CVS Health IT standards and procedures. The Lead will ensure consistent alignment of technical solutions with the business goals and objectives of the supported unit.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will serve as a senior application developer lead providing industry leading technical direction and guidance to the RxClaim application development teams to ensure appropriate and cost effective application of CVS Health approved technologies.<BR><BR>As part of the Rx Claim Adjudication team, you will be expected to be proficient in all critical functions of the application development and will champion SDLC methodologies with a deep understanding of best practices to ensure that quality standards are met. We believe for success, you should have flexibility, possess a positive outlook, discernment, and inspire change within a fast growing environment.<BR><BR>The AS400 Application Development Advisor will be responsible for, but not limited to:<BR> Lead development estimation activities and present to senior leaders<BR> Make certain appropriate and effective data integration across multiple applications<BR> Provide solutions and design complex functionality within the RxClaim application<BR> Positively mentor and lead assigned team projects and mentor junior resources as needed<BR> Review technical solutions and document projects, for example: Analysis &#038; Designs Program specifications and Code Reviews<BR> Help define standards, methodologies, and guidelines to ensure compliance while aligning solutions to the RxClaim application architecture</p>
<p><b>Required Qualifications</b><br /> 5+ years of experience and a demonstrated deep understanding of AS400 application development including the following:<BR> 3+ years of experience leading concurrent technical projects on IBM iSeries<BR> 3+ years of application development experience in RPG, RPGLE, and CL.<BR>1+ Year of Synon experience.</p>
<p><b>Preferred Qualifications</b><br /> Application development experience in Synon2/E and COOL 2/E<BR> 3+ years of IBMi SQL experience<BR> Experience with RxClaim or other PBM Adjudication system is preferred<BR> Experience in COBOL<BR> Demonstrated successful completion of several medium to large scope projects<BR> Proficiency working on all phases of SDLC and with problem determination and resolution through research and fact finding</p>
<p><b>Education</b><br />Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent required. Will accept a verifiable H.S. diploma / GED with one year of relevant work experience for every year college not attained in addition to required years of experience.</p>
<p><b>Business Overview</b><br />At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health.  We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  </p>
<p> <BR>We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.<br />
<a href="https://www.applytracking.com/tp/rj6-thnfN-I-K" class="fusion-button button-default fusion-button-default-size bottom-apply apply-btn">Apply</a></p>
<p>

<p>Please note that we only accept applications for employment via this site. We provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities as needed. To request an accommodation  including a qualified interpreter, written information in other formats, translation or other services  please email <a href="mailto:AdviceandCounsel@cvshealth.com" title="Send Email">AdviceandCounsel@cvshealth.com</a> or call <a href="tel:877-805-9511" title="Phone number">877-805-9511</a>. If you have a speech or hearing disability, please call 7-1-1 to utilize Telecommunications Relay Services (TRS). We will make every effort to respond to your request within 48 business hours and do everything we can to work towards a solution.</p>
<p>If technical issues are preventing you from applying, contact Kenexa Helpdesk at <a href="tel:1-855-338-5609" title="Phone number">1-855-338-5609</a> or <a href="mailto:cvshealthsupport@us.ibm.com" title="Send Email">cvshealthsupport@us.ibm.com</a>.</p>
<p>For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout, contact the Modern Hire Help Desk at <a href="tel:1-877-451-1695" title="Phone number">1-877-451-1695</a> or <a href="mailto:cvs_support@modernhire.com" title="Send Email">cvs_support@modernhire.com</a>.</p>
<p>The health and safety of our employees, patients, customers, and members is our top priority as we face the impact of COVID-19 together. We encourage you to visit our COVID-19 resource center to learn more.</p>

<p>We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status.</p>
